rationale: This sprint establishes the foundational local Mac environment with NFR-001 (Node.js/Express backend on port 3001, React frontend on 3000, SQLite DB, npm scripts for start/stop/setup). US-009 then implements user authentication (login/logout with email/password, role-based sessions, hashed passwords) on this foundation, enabling secure access for all future features. Dependencies: US-009 relies on the database and session management from NFR-001. Testable via local runs: Verify env setup with npm start, then test login form and role checks. Aligns with vision for lightweight, GDPR-compliant MVP on Mac. ~20 minutes total execution.
